humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions like a silk rope. Shirakawa thinks that the white-like wire bundle is tied up, soaked in a dye vat, and dyed black. The ancient meaning of " Xuan " is " black. " Probably because black has a little red color, the color is profound and remote, and it is difficult to distinguish. Later, it extends the meanings of profound, remote, and mysterious. "Shuowen": "Mysterious, distant and distant. Black and red is mystery. Like the lonely and into the overlying. All mysteries belong to the mystery. ğ µ“, the ancient text and the mystery." Wang Yun's "Shu Wenju Reading" points to the ancient " Xuan " and " Yao " have the same form, but the sound and meaning are different. Jin Guotai, He Linyi and others believe that " Xuan " and " Yao " are the differentiation of the word. As for the extension of the meaning of " Xuan ", Lin Yiguang believes that the original meaning of " xuan " is the shape of silk, and the original meaning is hanging.

Jia Jin inscription means red and black, "Collection" 33276: "Three Profound Cows", that is, three red and black cows. Song Ding: "Yi (Gi) Girl (Ru) Xuan Yi Yu Tun (Pure)", " Pure " means the edge of the dress, meaning a red-black top with embroidered patterned edges. This kind of dress is used for worship and ceremonies.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period are red and black, and the bamboo slips from the Tomb of the Marquis of Zeng Yi 79: "Xuan Yu", that is, red and black feathers. It also expresses profound and mysterious, "Guodian Jian. "Lao Zi Jia" Jan. 8: "A person who is good in ancient times must not be (micro) drowning (miao) xuanda, and profoundness (knowledge)." The short article says that people who are good at ancient times must be subtle and profound. , Deep and understanding, too deep to know (Liu Zhao). "Guodian Jane. "Lao Tzu A" Jane 27-28: "Close the door, match (plug) the door, harmonize (its) light, pass through the dust, extract the glory of (its), and solve it. It means the stomach (so-called) mystery.â€ It means closing its eyes, eyes, nose, mouth and other orifices, blocking the door of its body, and accumulating its brilliance, to gain access to its dust, to remove its edge, and to resolve its disputes. It is called "Xuan Tong" (Liu Zhao).

(8) Far; far away.
(9) Big.

(11) Ancient Chinese philosophers refer to the ontology of the universe.
(12) In the book "Laozi", "Tao" is called "Xuanzhi and Xuan", and later because it refers to Taoism.
(13) Refers to Buddhism. See "Xuanjiang", "Xuanji".
